text: Hi, quick question related to lazy loading <https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/adesignl-lazyloadingscript?hsLang=en>
is it possible to make more scalable implementation, without adding 'Add `loading="lazy"` to your images and iframes' to every image

Well, I would advise creating modules that house your images, and having that attribute in there, if you want to take advantage of it.

You don’t want to implement `loading="lazy"` to every image, only images that it makes sense to lazy load.

For example if you have a logo in your site header - I wouldn’t load that lazy because it’s the first thing everyone sees, and it’s on every page.

If you build modules to do this, you’re not hand coding this for every image, you’re just using your module like you normally would.

You can even add a toggle to disable the attribute for instances you don’t want to use that.
